enWisdom: Muteness is better than inarticulateness (or error)
The inability of effective expression weakens the argument

Wisdom: الْقَوْلُ بِالْحَقِّ خَيْرٌ مِنَ الْعِيِّ وَالصَّمْتِ
enWisdom: Speaking the truth is better than inarticulateness and silence
Many a word is more piercing than an arrow
One who sets his tongue aright adorns his intellect

Wisdom: مَنْ سَدَّدَ مَقَالَهُ بَرْهَنَ عَنْ غَزَارَةِ فَضْلِهِ
enWisdom: One who makes his speech prudent proves the abundance of his merit

Wisdom: مَنِ اكْتَفَى بِالتَّلْوِيحِ اسْتَغْنَى عَنِ التَّصْرِيحِ
enWisdom: One who settles for hinting [and indirect reference] becomes needless of declaration

Wisdom: مَنْ قَامَ بِفَتْقِ الْقَوْلِ وَرَتْقِهِ فَقَدْ حَانَ [خَانَ‏] الْبَلَاغَةَ
enWisdom: One who undertakes the rending and mending of speech has attained eloquence
One of the signs of intelligence is speaking what is right

Wisdom: مِنْ عَلَامَاتِ الْإِقْبَالِ سَدَادُ الْأَقْوَالِ وَالرِّفْقُ فِي الْأَفْعَالِ
enWisdom: From the signs of turning [to Allah] are: correctness of speech and kindness in actions
